Key Arguments: The bill violates Article 19 of the Universal Declaration of Human Rights, which guarantees freedom of opinion and expression.
Individuals have the right to hold and communicate their ideas without government interference.
There is a risk that ACMA could censor true facts if they are factually incorrect.
The bill creates a double standard by excluding government-authorized content from censorship.
The bill could enable government propaganda while suppressing opposing views.
Notable Quotes: This bill clearly goes against the Universal Declaration of Human Rights Article 19.
It is dangerous to give such powers to unelected and unaccountable bureaucrats.
This is a dangerous bill and must not go through.
